Name: Y Combinator
Perk: $500k funding on 2 separate safes: $125,000 on a post-money safe in return for 7%, $375,000 on an uncapped safe with a Most Favored Nation (“MFN”) provision; each founder is assigned a dedicated group partner who has mentored hundreds of YC companies; free credits or significant discounts on hosting, banking, cap table management, back office, and much more; access to over 9000 YC alumni through private social network Bookface; access to YC Investor Database which has profiles and reviews for more than 50,000 startup investors
One-line description: A venture capital firm and startup accelerator that helps early-stage entrepreneurs.

Name: Anthology Fund
Perk: over $100k funding; $25k Anthropic credits; regular access to the Anthropic team; quarterly deep dives with Menlo and Anthropic leaders and developer relations team; biannual demo days hosted by the Menlo partners and Anthropic leaders; credits from Menlo Ventures’ companies; fractional workspace access in Menlo Ventures’ SF and Menlo Park offices
Qualifications: Pre-Seed, Seed, or Series A; prefer to invest in companies based in the U.S.
One-line description: A $100 million venture capital fund launched by Menlo Ventures and Anthropic designed to invest in and accelerate the growth of early-stage startups.
